TextBody:
ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FPrBq:ref

Thank you for the response.

At this time, we're OK to close the support ticket. We've asked our customer to move forward with this version on any hosts that experience this issue.

Nicholas

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: Friday, November 1, 2024 4:07 PM
To: Natale, Nicholas J (US) <nicholas.j.natale@lmco.com>
Cc: sean.comiskey@netwrix.com; john.hilsher@netwrix.com
Subject: EXTERNAL: RE: EXTERNAL: Netwrix Support Ticket #420277 - - EXTERNAL: Clients showing offline and expired [ [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FPrBq:ref ]

Hello Nicholas,

With nothing confirmed, the guess could be that if there was a corrupt config or misconfigured config, then installing a newer agent could have overwritten that with a good one and resolved the connectivity issue. Hope this helps.

Thank you,
Zachary Roy

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FPrBq:ref


Zach,

We've passed the troubleshooting steps of killing the process onto our customer and will await their feedback to see if it's helped.

One final question, and probably the hardest question we'll ask...

Is there anything you or your team could point to as a cause of our initial issue (a client showing as offline and expired) and how the upgrade to 1.7.0.7 might have resolved it? I know this is a very specific ask, but our customer would like to better understand what may have changed in 1.7.0.7 to make the issue go away.

Thank you!

Nicholas

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com<mailto:techsupport@netwrix.com>>
Sent: Monday, October 28, 2024 4:55 PM
To: Natale, Nicholas J (US) <nicholas.j.natale@lmco.com<mailto:nicholas.j.natale@lmco.com>>
Cc: sean.comiskey@netwrix.com<mailto:sean.comiskey@netwrix.com>; john.hilsher@netwrix.com<mailto:john.hilsher@netwrix.com>
Subject: EXTERNAL: RE: EXTERNAL: Netwrix Support Ticket #420277 - - EXTERNAL: Clients showing offline and expired [ [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FPrBq:ref ]

Hello Nicholas,

On version 1.7.0.7 there is no alternative way of opening the notifier.

When the issue is seen, make sure the About dialog window is not open (it prevents the right-click menu from opening).
Other than that you could try to kill the notifier and reopen it: pkill epp-client

Thank you,
Zachary Roy

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FPrBq:ref


Zach,

Upon installing EPP client version 1.7.0.7, our customer no longer sees the host showing as "offline" within the EPP web UI. We're hoping this has resolved the original issue that they were seeing.

We would like to ask a question related to our EPP clients: sporadically, we see times where right-clicking on the EPP tray icon does not produce the context menu shown below:

[cid:image001.png@01DB3122.026DA1F0]

Is there an alternative method to open the Endpoint Protect Client window? We have found the issue to be very intermittent (sometimes logging off/on fixes it). Our customer has also reported this issue, so we'd like to know if there's any other way we can launch the GUI in the event that the tray icon doesn't work.

Thanks!

Nicholas

From: Natale, Nicholas J (US)
Sent: Tuesday, October 22, 2024 4:27 PM
To: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com<mailto:techsupport@netwrix.com>>

Subject: RE: EXTERNAL: RE: EXTERNAL: Netwrix Support Ticket #420277 - - EXTERNAL: Clients showing offline and expired [ [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FPrBq:ref ]

Zach,

We're awaiting data back from our customer. We were unable to get client version 2.4.4.1000 working on our systems; we've asked our customer to install client version 1.7.0.7 on the impacted system. We've been able to produce log files with that version internally, so we're hoping to get a meaningful log file back from our customer soon.

Nicholas

Thank you,
Zachary Roy

Hello Nicholas,

Engineering has found that the version currently installed does not generate the logs when given the commands provided. Engineering have provided a new build at the link below to resolve that so we can get logs from the affected machines. Please install this build and perform the following steps again to collect the logs from the system

cd /var/log/epp-client/
touch epp_client_daemon.log
sudo service epp-client-daemon-d restart

wait the 2 minutes, then copy the log file to the desktop and send it to the ticket.


https://download.endpointprotector.com/linux_agent/EPPClient_2.4.4.1000/EPPClient_centos_7_v2.4.4.1000_x86_64.tar.gz

Thank you,
Zachary Roy

Subject: EXTERNAL: RE: EXTERNAL: Netwrix Support Ticket #420277 - - EXTERNAL: Clients showing offline and expired [ [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FPrBq:ref ]


Hello Madealya,

Our engineer tested with a similar version, but not exact and was able to get the logging to work as expected. Could you provide your installer so that it will be a like for like test?

Also, engineering is requesting the following:

Please provide the output of "journalctl --system"
also run epp-client-daemon with strace to see information about the log file access;
please make sure the service is stopped;
also check with "ps -aux | grep epp" that epp-client-daemon isn't running;
then run "sudo strace /opt/cososys/sbin/epp-client-daemon -e 2>&1 | tee epp-strace";
Ctrl-C after the startup sequence is done; and send the generated "epp-strace" file to us

Thank you,
Zachary Roy

Subject: RE: EXTERNAL: Netwrix Support Ticket #420277 - - EXTERNAL: Clients showing offline and expired [ ]




Zach,

We've already confirmed with our customer that the service is not crashing. Once the service starts, it remains up.

Here are the logs we got from them a few months back when we asked them to run "journalctl -u epp-client-daemon-d":
-- Logs begin at Mon 2024-07-29 08:45:12 JST, end at Thu 2024-08-01 17:25:42 JST. -- Jul 29 08:45:40 yrp-rce1 systemd[1]: Starting LSB: Endpoint Protector Client...
Jul 29 08:45:41 yrp-rce1 epp-client-daemon-d[5788]: Starting Endpoint Protector Client [done][ OK ] Jul 29 08:45:41 yrp-rce1 systemd[1]: Started LSB: Endpoint Protector Client.

This shows that the service is running fine & without any errors/crashes.

Just as a reminder, our clients are still running version 1.3.1.5. We have not advised our customer to upgrade the client yet. Is the logging you describe supported in client version 1.3.1.5?

Thanks,
Madealya

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com<mailto:techsupport@netwrix.com>>
Sent: Monday, October 7, 2024 12:11 PM
To: Mahaffey, Madealya R (US) <madealya.r.mahaffey@lmco.com<mailto:madealya.r.mahaffey@lmco.com>>
Cc: Natale, Nicholas J (US) <nicholas.j.natale@lmco.com<mailto:nicholas.j.natale@lmco.com>>; john.hilsher@netwrix.com<mailto:john.hilsher@netwrix.com>; sean.comiskey@netwrix.com<mailto:sean.comiskey@netwrix.com>
Subject: EXTERNAL: RE: EXTERNAL: Netwrix Support Ticket #420277 - - EXTERNAL: Clients showing offline and expired [ ]

Hello Madealya,

The difference between the append logs and the regular logs that were run prior, are that the regular logs will reset themselves each time the agent or the machine restarts. With the append logs, the logs are retained through restarts. So, if we are in a case of the agent crashing and restarting, wiping the logs each time, then the append logs will capture that.

Thank you,
Zachary Roy

Subject: RE: EXTERNAL: Netwrix Support Ticket #420277 - - EXTERNAL: Clients showing offline and expired [ ]




Hi Zach,

This is almost the exact procedure we already gave our customer. The only difference is making the log file name "epp_client_daemon_append.log" instead of "epp_client_daemon.log". Is there a technical reason why changing the name would yield a different result? If not, I'm confident that the log file would just be empty again.

Are there any alternative steps that we can attempt next?

Thanks,
Madealya

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com<mailto:techsupport@netwrix.com>>
Sent: Monday, October 7, 2024 10:56 AM
To: Mahaffey, Madealya R (US) <madealya.r.mahaffey@lmco.com<mailto:madealya.r.mahaffey@lmco.com>>
Cc: Natale, Nicholas J (US) <nicholas.j.natale@lmco.com<mailto:nicholas.j.natale@lmco.com>>; john.hilsher@netwrix.com<mailto:john.hilsher@netwrix.com>; sean.comiskey@netwrix.com<mailto:sean.comiskey@netwrix.com>
Subject: EXTERNAL: RE: EXTERNAL: Netwrix Support Ticket #420277 - - EXTERNAL: Clients showing offline and expired [ ]

Hello Madealya,

Since that did not work, can we try the following:

1. $ sudo su
2. $ cd /var/log/epp-client/
3. $ touch /var/log/epp-client/epp_client_daemon_append.log
4. $ sudo service epp-client-daemon restart 5. Wait 2 minutes for issue to reproduce 6. $ cp /var/log/epp-client/epp_client_daemon_append.log /home/user/Desktop/

Thank you,
Zachary Roy

Subject: EXTERNAL: RE: EXTERNAL: Netwrix Support Ticket #420277 - - EXTERNAL: Clients showing offline and expired [ ]

Hello Nicholas,

Engineering has gotten back to us after looking into the issue and they require additional logs from one of the affected machines. Specifically, the epp_client_daemon.log. If you could collect this from a few of the affected machines and upload them to the case, I will send those to engineering and they can continue their investigation.

To collect the logs, please run the following and then wait for 2 minutes before copying the logs to the desktop for collection.

cd /var/log/epp-client/
touch epp_client_daemon.log
sudo service epp-client-daemon-d restart (if this command fails, change epp-client-daemon-d to epp-client-daemon)

wait the 2 minutes, then copy the log file to the desktop and send it to the ticket.

A few extra items as well, do you have a load balancer in the environment and is it network or application?

Also, could you open EPP Notifier on one of the machines and press control + alt + i and tell me if you see the server IP address there and if it is the correct one?

Thank you,
Zachary Roy
